definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to excavate/to explore/(fig.) to unearth/to tap into
to excavate/to dig out/fig. to investigate (in an archive)
lit. not to dig a well until one is thirsty/to be unprepared and seek help at the last minute (idiom)
to exhume a body for public flogging (idiom)
Drinking the water of a well, one should never forget who dug it. (idiom)
pinyin: chi1 shui3 bu4 wang4 jue2 jing3 ren2

sentences.english: They dug through the mountain to build a tunnel.
sentences.chinese: 他们掘穿大山筑一条隧道。

sentences.english: Finally, Winter nuzzled up to her shoulder.
sentences.chinese: 最后，“冬天”用鼻子掘她的肩膀。

sentences.english: The moles borrowed holes in the ground.
He who digs a pit for others, falls in himself.
sentences.chinese: 想坑别人的人，跌进自己掘得陷阱里。

sentences.english: Bob pecked at the hard ground with a pickaxe.
sentences.chinese: 他用鹤嘴锄掘坚硬的土地。

sentences.english: The pig is obliged to dig a big pit for the pigeon.
sentences.chinese: 猪被迫为西方经济学论文鸽子掘一个大坑。

sentences.english: Graveyard recursion is a huge theme for the green and black guild.
sentences.chinese: 黑绿重要的主题之一就是掘坟。

sentences.english: If those moles carry on digging,there will soon be no grass left.
sentences.chinese: 如果那些鼹鼠继续掘地，很快将没有草留下。

sentences.english: They tunnelled their way into an underground palace.
sentences.chinese: 他们掘隧道进入了一个地下宫殿。

sentences.english: The battalion went directly to the airport to begin digging in.
sentences.chinese: 该营直接开到机场掘壕防守。

sentences.english: In order to build cities, we dig digging.
sentences.chinese: 为了建造城市，我们挖山掘地。

sentences.english: Knowledge is like the spring water underground----the deeper you dig, the clearer is the water.
sentences.chinese: 知识好像地下的泉水，掘得越深越清澈。

sentences.english: I threw her digging stick into the pandanus bushes.
sentences.chinese: 我就把她的掘棒丢到林投树丛去。

sentences.english: She hates himself, why to dig three feet again to the ex-wife back?
sentences.chinese: 她恨死本人了，为什么要再掘地三尺把前妻找回来？

sentences.english: I can see through the gate of that house the gardener digging the ground.
sentences.chinese: 从一家门口，我看得见一个园丁在那里掘地。

sentences.english: Both the Hori and Pelican offerings are priced at $30, but which is the one to buy?
sentences.chinese: 无论是掘和鹈鹕产品的售价为30美元，但它是一买？

definition: chisel/to bore a hole/to chisel or dig/(literary) (bound form) certain/authentic/irrefutable/also pr. [zuo4]
to raze to the ground/to demolish
Jing, one of the 28 constellations of Chinese astronomy/surname Jing
big/stream or canal/drain/ditch/CL:條|条[tiao2]/him (dialect)/outer rim of a carriage wheel (old)
rampart/base (in baseball)/to build with stones, bricks etc
to cut (a canal, tunnel, well etc)
short name for Guiyang 貴陽|贵阳[Gui4 yang2]
to build/to construct/to ram/to hit/Taiwan pr. [zhu2]
to pilot a ship/to channel water/to draw water (for irrigation)
